title: Delhi Capitals Coach Takes Up Coaching Role in Major League Cricket (MLC) in USA
body:
Former India bowler, Munaf Patel will join the Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket (MLC) as a bowling coach. Delhi Capitals (DC) recently appointed him in the same role ahead of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025. Munaf has been working extensively with DC bowlers in the camp.

The GMR group, co-owners of Delhi Capitals, has a stake in Seattle Orcas and might have decided to extend Munaf’s role in the franchise. The Seattle-based franchise already has Matthew Mott (head coach) and Venugopal Rao (GM of cricket operations), who are also with the Capitals on the coaching staff.

Ian Bell is the batting coach, so the coaching department is supremely talented. Munaf’s coaching experience is not vast, but he will know how to work in a franchise environment in IPL 2025.

However, his superior knowledge, earned by playing for India and the domestic side, will be handy for any team he works with. Munaf has always been highly rated as a pacer and will pass on the knowledge with a fresh set of players in the coaching department in India and the USA.

Munaf Patel and his international and franchise experience

Munaf Patel played all three formats for India during his peak years, featuring in 13 Tests, 70 ODIs, and three T20Is between 2006 and 2011. Overall, he has 125 wickets at 32.30 runs apiece in 86 matches for India.

Munaf was part of the World Cup 2011 winning squad, taking 11 wickets at an average of 32.09 in eight outings, with a best of 4/48. The 41-year-old has also played 63 IPL matches, spanning three franchises – Rajasthan Royals (2008-2010), Mumbai Indians (2011-2013), and Gujarat Lions (2017).

Munaf has 74 wickets at an average of 22.94 in 63 IPL innings, including two four-wicket and a five-wicket haul. He has won two IPL championships as a player, with Rajasthan Royals in 2008 and Mumbai Indians in 2013.

He also played four matches for Kandy Tuskers in the Lanka Premier League, snaring three wickets at 32.33 runs apiece. Munaf has ample T20 experience and will share his knowledge with bowlers on the coaching staff.
summary:
* Former Indian bowler Munaf Patel has been appointed as the bowling coach of the Seattle Orcas in Major League Cricket (MLC).
* Munaf's appointment is likely due to the GMR group, co-owners of Delhi Capitals, having a stake in the Seattle Orcas franchise.
* The Seattle Orcas' coaching department also includes Matthew Mott (head coach), Venugopal Rao (GM of cricket operations), and Ian Bell (batting coach).
* Munaf's experience as a player and coach will be valuable to the team, despite his limited coaching experience.
* Munaf has extensive experience playing for India and in domestic tournaments, including the Indian Premier League (IPL) and the Lanka Premier League.

title: IPL 2025: DC Ignore KL Rahul; Appoints Veteran As Vice-Captain
body:
Delhi Capitals (DC) have confirmed the appointment of 40-year-old Faf du Plessis as their vice-captain for the 2025 Indian Premier League season. The franchise took to social media on March 17 (Monday) to announce their decision, ignoring KL Rahul, who everyone expected to be in some leadership role.

Faf was a successful leader in the last edition of the Caribbean Premier League (CPL), helping the St Lucia Kings to a title. However, elsewhere, in both Major League Cricket (MLC) and SA20, the 40-year-old hasn’t led his team to the silverware.

As recently as last year, Faf was still actively leading the IPL when he led Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) to the playoffs, beating arch-rivals CSK in the last group stage game.
summary: * Faf du Plessis, the newly appointed vice-captain of Delhi Capitals, has not led his team to a title in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.

title: Ian Bell, Munaf Patel join Seattle Orcas coaching staff
body:
The Seattle Orcas are thrilled to welcome Ian Bell as our new batting coach and Munaf Patel as our new bowling coach ahead of Major League Cricket Season 3. They join recently appointed head coach Matthew Mott to round out our coaching staff.

Former England batter Ian Bell steps in as our batting coach, taking over from Ross Taylor.

An England legend, Bell recently led the Dubai Capitals to their first-ever ILT20 title in the UAE. He’s also coached Sri Lanka, New Zealand, and several other top franchises.

During his 11-year international career, Bell was known for his elegant cover drives and amassed over 13,000 runs across nearly 300 matches. He also played a key role in England’s historic Test-series win in India (2012-13).

Joining him is 2011 ICC ODI World Cup champion Munaf Patel, who replaces Shane Bond as our bowling coach.

Patel played a crucial role in helping the Dubai Capitals secure their first ILT20 championship as their bowling coach.

The former Indian pacer will link up with the Orcas after finishing his IPL 2025 season with the Delhi Capitals.

Renowned for his accuracy and relentless line and length, Patel took 125 wickets in 86 international matches for India. He also won two IPL titles, with the Rajasthan Royals and Mumbai Indians.

With their wealth of experience, Ian Bell and Munaf Patel are set to make a big impact on the Seattle Orcas as we gear up for the 2025 Major League Cricket season.

Podsquad, let’s give them a warm welcome!
summary: The Seattle Orcas have appointed Ian Bell as their new batting coach and Munaf Patel as their new bowling coach ahead of Major League Cricket Season 3. Bell, a former England batter, replaces Ross Taylor, while Patel, a former Indian pacer, replaces Shane Bond. Both coaches bring significant experience, with Bell having led the Dubai Capitals to an ILT20 title and Patel having won the 2011 ICC ODI World Cup and two IPL titles. They will join head coach Matthew Mott to form the Orcas' coaching staff for the 2025 season.
